Issues.Title: [Nuxt 3] Custom colors don't change once set
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/11557
Originally posted by **CJ-Uy-EVC** July 6, 2023 I am currently working on a nuxt 3 project. After setting my custom colors the first time it no longer changes even when the value in the tailwind.config.js is changed. I've already tried deleting the `.nuxt` folder and running `npx nuxi cleanup` yet when restarting the page it still does not change anything. To add to the confusion going to the `Tailwind Viewer: http://localhost:3000/_tailwind/ ` shows that the NEW correct custom colors not the previous ones being shown in the available colors section. I'm really not quite sure how to fix this issue. Thank you for your time and help in advance! tailwind.config.js ``` import FormKitVariants from "@formkit/themes/tailwindcss"; module.exports = { content: [ "./components/**/*.{js,vue,ts}", "./layouts/**/*.vue", "./pages/**/*.vue", "./plugins/**/*.{js,ts}", "./nuxt.config.{js,ts}", "./app.vue", "./src/**/*.{html,js,vue}", "./node_modules/@formkit/themes/dist/tailwindcss/genesis/index.cjs", ], theme: { extend: { screens: { xs: "614px", sm: "1002px", md: "1022px", lg: "1092px", xl: "1280px", }, colors: { primary: "#0083f7", secondary: "#22397d", offWhite: "#f8f9fe", important: "#d93558", clearGreen: "#5cb388", }, }, }, plugins: [FormKitVariants], }; ``` On my component: ``` ``` I also found that if you do `class = "hover:bg-primary"` it uses the currently place correct color not the previous one
I've tried deleting the node_modules folder and clearing cache to no avail. WEIRDER YET, I've tried to delete the github folder and reclonning the whole repository yet it was still the same.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Nuxt 3] Custom colors don't change once set" (#11573)

Issues.Title: A array map displays the rank data, starting from the third item, the dynamic w- attribute is not added to the div
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** "tailwindcss": "^3.3.2", **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** "next": "^13.4.8", **What version of Node.js are you using?** v18.13.0 **What browser are you using?** Edge **What operating system are you using?** Win11 **Reproduction URL** A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways. A reproduction is **required** when filing an issue — any issue opened without a reproduction will be closed and you'll be asked to create a new issue that includes a reproduction. We're a small team and we can't keep up with the volume of issues we receive if we need to reproduce each issue from scratch ourselves. **Describe your issue** Array map displays the rank data, starting from the second item, the dynamic w- attribute is not added to the div. The demo data: ` export const RankData = [ { rank: 'NO.1', name: '济南市', value: 90 }, { rank: 'NO.2', name: '青岛市', value: 80 }, { rank: 'NO.3', name: '烟台市', value: 70 }, { rank: 'NO.4', name: '潍坊市', value: 60 }, { rank: 'NO.5', name: '临沂市', value: 50 }, { rank: 'NO.6', name: '济宁市', value: 40 }, { rank: 'NO.7', name: '淄博市', value: 30 }, { rank: 'NO.8', name: '菏泽市', value: 20 }, { rank: 'NO.9', name: '德州市', value: 10 }, { rank: 'NO.10', name: '东营市', value: 5 }, ] ` And the component code : ``` import React from 'react' import {RankData} from "@/constants/data"; type RankItemType = { rank: string, name: string, value: number } const RankItem = (item: RankItemType) => (
{item.rank}
{item.name}
 
{/*
 
*/}
) const ActivityRank = () => { return (
{RankData.map((item, index) => )}
) } export default ActivityRank ``` And the first and the second div add the width property: .w-\[90px\] { width: 80px; } The third div don't have the width property at all. I don't know why, thanks a lot.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "A array map displays the rank data, starting from the third item, the dynamic w- attribute is not added to the div" (#11566)

Issues.Title: Span's cannot be inline for group translate/transform modifiers to act as expected. (Note in the docs?)
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

Maybe this is something already known well in web development about the default quality of inline elements such as span, but group-selector actions involving transforms will fail to work if the span is still set to inline. However, if the span's display is set to `block` (or it is the child of a container making it not inline, like a parent flex div) the transforms will work. 

I doubt this is a bug, but perhaps it should be explicitly noted in the docs just as a heads up to newer developers?

Here's a tailwindplay to demonstrate: https://play.tailwindcss.com/mR5rXnUQO4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Span's cannot be inline for group translate/transform modifiers to act as expected. (Note in the docs?)" (#11541)

Issues.Title: Unable to Import Component Files After @tailwind Declaration
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
^3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
- postcss-import ^15.1.0
- vue ^3.3.4
- @vitejs/plugin-vue ^4.2.3
- autoprefixer ^10.4.14
- postcss ^8.4.25
- tailwindcss ^3.3.2
- vite ^4.4.0

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v19.6.0

**What browser are you using?**
Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**
macOS

**Reproduction URL**
https://github.com/rizkimuhammada/rep

**Describe your issue**
I followed the step-by-step guide provided in the [Tailwind CSS documentation](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/guides/vite#vue) to set up Tailwind CSS with Vite and Vue. However, I encountered an issue while trying to import my component files after the @tailwind declaration.

To reproduce the issue, I followed these steps:

- Installed the "postcss-import" package using the command `npm install postcss-import`.
- Created a main file to import my component files, following the example given in the [Tailwind CSS documentation](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/using-with-preprocessors#build-time-imports).

Expected behavior: I expected to be able to import my component files successfully after the @tailwind declaration.

Actual behavior: Despite following the documentation example precisely, I found that the imports after the @tailwind declaration were not working as expected. I am unable to import my component files.

`12:05:55 AM [vite] Internal server error: [postcss] postcss-import: /Users/muhammadrizkia/Desktop/Projects/my-project/src/custom-components.css:1:1: `@layer components` is used but no matching `@tailwind components` directive is present.`

Please note that I have a basic understanding of Vue, Tailwind CSS, and using the command line interface. I believe this issue may be related to the order of imports or the configuration setup.

I would appreciate any guidance or assistance to resolve this issue. Let me know if you need any additional information.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to Import Component Files After @tailwind Declaration" (#11560)

Issues.Title: Variables are sometimes used in tailwind and sometimes not.
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v.3.2.7 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** "webpack-cli": "^5.0.1", "webpack-dev-server": "^4.12.0", "workbox-webpack-plugin": "^6.5.4" "react": "^18.2.0", "react-dom": "^18.2.0", "react-router-dom": "^6.9.0", **What version of Node.js are you using?** v16.15.1 **What browser are you using?** Chrome **What operating system are you using?** Windows10 **Describe your issue** Describe the problem you're seeing, any important steps to reproduce and what behavior you expect instead. ```javascript import React, { useState } from "react"; import { TableHeader } from "../commons/TableHeader"; import { TableCell } from "../commons/TableCell"; export const Table = () => { const [name, setName] = useState(""); const [file, setFile] = useState(""); const [state, setState] = useState(""); const [content, setContent] = useState(""); const [textareaList, setTextareaList] = useState([ "", "", "", "", "", "", "", ]); const [colNum, setColNum] = useState(0); const checkingGridcols = () => { if (colNum < 10) { const gridcols = [ "grid-cols-1", "grid-cols-2", "grid-cols-3", "grid-cols-4", "grid-cols-5", "grid-cols-6", "grid-cols-7", "grid-cols-8", "grid-cols-9", "grid-cols-10", "grid-cols-11", "grid-cols-12", ]; return gridcols[colNum]; } else { alert("Don't increasing."); return "grid-cols-10"; } }; const testGridcols = () => { const gridcols = `grid-cols-${colNum}`; return gridcols; }; const gridcols = `grid-cols-${colNum}`; const addTextarea = () => { setTextareaList([...textareaList, ...Array(colNum).fill("")]); // console.log(textareaList); }; const addTextCol = () => { setColNum(colNum + 1); // let addTextareaList: string[] = []; // textareaList.map((row, index) => { // if ((index + 1) % colNum === 0) { // addTextareaList.push(row, ""); // } else { // addTextareaList.push(row); // } // }); // // console.log(addTextareaList); console.log(colNum); // setTextareaList(addTextareaList); }; return (
{/*
*/} {textareaList.map((textarea, index) => ( //
{index}
))}
); }; ``` I want to change `grid-cols-${variable}`. variable is useState. But that's not working except function checkingGridcols in react. I tried to replace the variables by putting them into tailwind, but that's not the way tailwind works, so I thought I'd pre-create them as strings. const testGridcols = () => { const gridcols = `grid-cols-${colNum}`; return gridcols; }; const gridcols = `grid-cols-${colNum}`; I've tried making them both functions and variables, but sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't, so I'm confused. What should I do?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Variables are sometimes used in tailwind and sometimes not." (#11556)

To avoid style conflicts, I added the configuration prefix: "t-" in tailwind.config.js . But when I dynamically set the dark style class, the ”dark:“ condition has no effect on styles. `document.documentElement.classList.add("dark");` `test`

Issues.Title: Breakpoints not working on production (NextJS/Vercel)
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

Tailwindcss v3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

NextJS v13.1.6

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

Node v18 LTS

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Zorin (Ubuntu/Linux)

**Reproduction URL**

https://nexo-front-355qt1rau-nexo-team.vercel.app

**Describe your issue**

- The breakpoint style its applied only after i change the screen (like its applied with JS)

- When i change the screen, the breakpoint style is applied at the bottom of the browser element styles list
 
## Screen with 767px
- Only 3 styles
- Display must be: hidden

- Display is: hidden
![Captura de tela de 2023-07-05 17-52-34](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/61320909/948ffbe8-efd4-478b-a177-affd59a51b47)

## Screen with 769px (md breakpoint)
- 4 styles (now the breakpoint style is applied on the bottom os the styles list)
- Display must be: flex
- Display is: hidden (display hidden stay on top of the breakpoint style)
![Captura de tela de 2023-07-05 17-53-09](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/61320909/4fc8e5a8-9d81-4361-8f02-edc57f9cb664)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Breakpoints not working on production (NextJS/Vercel)" (#11552)

Issues.Title: Make PostCSS plugin async to improve performance
Issues.Body:
This PR improves the performance by making the main plugin async. This means that we can replace a bunch of `fs.readFileSync` calls for each template file with a `Promise.all(f => fs.promises.readFile(f))` instead, without blocking IO.

<!--

👋 Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Make PostCSS plugin async to improve performance" (#11548)

Issues.Title: [postcss] Cannot create property tailwind.config.js on string node-jiti (File: index.css)
Issues.Body:
**Tailwind**: v3.3.2
**Vite**: v4.3.9
**React**: v18.2.0
**Node**: v19.0.0
**Browser**: Chrome
**OS**: Windows
**pnpm**: V8.6.5
**Reproduction URL**: https://github.com/talkohavy/vite-tailwind-bug

## **Describing the issue**
All I did was simply create a new vite project, with react, and follow your documentation on how to add tailwind.
The steps being:
1. npm create vite@latest my-project -- --template react
2. cd my-project
3. code .
4. pnpm add -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer
5. npx tailwindcss init -p
6. add content to tailwind.config.js:
  content: [
    "./index.html",
    "./src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}",
  ],
7. add to index.css these lines:
   @tailwind base;
   @tailwind components;
   @tailwind utilities;
8. run the command: npm run dev

After doing all that, when I run the start script of `npm run dev`, I open up the brower to see the app,
and get this error:

[plugin:vite:css] [postcss] **Cannot create property** '*******\my-project\tailwind.config.js' on string '*****/AppData/Local/Temp/node-jiti'

![1](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/51020442/d006d1f5-ec6b-4bb0-9c03-19e652991f17)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[postcss] Cannot create property tailwind.config.js on string node-jiti (File: index.css)" (#11546)

Issues.Title: Bump `jiti`, `lightningcss`, `fast-glob` and `browserlist` dependencies and reflect `lightningcss` related improvements in tests
Issues.Body:
This PR bumps some dependencies.

Started from #11546, it looks like jiti broke something, but a version bump fixes this. We already use a range in the version should we don't need to bump it but it doesn't hurt to make the versions up-to-date in the package.json.

This PR also updates some of the tests as a side effect of improvements in the `lightningcss` library.

Fixes #11546
<!--

👋 Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Bump `jiti`, `lightningcss`, `fast-glob` and `browserlist` dependencies and reflect `lightningcss` related improvements in tests" (#11550)

For example: v3.3.2

For example: React 18.2.0, vite 4.3.9

For example: v18.16.0

For example: Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

For example: Windows

**Reproduction URL**

none

**Describe your issue**
"When I was using the React.js framework and tailwindcss, I found a bug. If I write the code as className='grid grid-cols-4', 'grid' will not be compiled into 'display=grid'. However, if I write the code as className='grid-cols-4 grid', it will be compiled correctly." 
Describe the problem you're seeing, any important steps to reproduce and what behavior you expect instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "className="grid grid-cols-4"" (#11549)

Issues.Title: Tailwind CLI creates .css which violates MIT License
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

- Tailwind CLI

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

- v18.6.1

**What browser are you using?**

- Firefox 114.0.2 (64-bit)

**What operating system are you using?**

- Arch Linux

**Reproduction URL**

- N/A

**Describe your issue**
While I was writing a blog post on open licenses, I accidentally found that creating a `style.css` using Tailwind CSS (and probably other build tool as well?) outputs a `.css` file which doesn't have MIT License and copyright notice which are the only requirements for MIT License. To be clear, this is NOT about the Tailwind CSS github repo lincense BUT the output `.css` file created while using Tailwind CSS. This means even if I manually add the MIT License text, every time I rebuild the `style.css`, it will be overwritten. This means I am violating the MIT license and so are other Tailwind CSS users without knowing. 

Currently, the `.css` which has only `/*! tailwindcss v3.3.2 | MIT License | https://tailwindcss.com*/` instead of the copyright notice MIT License text which are required. 
- Link to my site's CSS - https://www.unsungnovelty.org/style.9d0af9572f6003cb392754fdaf78fdc5b409376cb976da8afe1901d0107e4b08.css

>MIT License
>
>Copyright (c) Tailwind Labs, Inc.
>
>Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

> **The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all
copies or substantial portions of the Software.**

If you go to https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/master/LICENSE, the conditions of the MIT License can be seen there as well.
![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/11845908/9105b55e-d0d6-4a1e-8aa8-5df26543f140)

I have had reported this previously on discord and [discussions](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/11094) instead of opening a bug report. But it didn't catch any attention and I waited a few months in the hope someone would've caught it.

Could the required License and Copyright notice be included while building a `.css` file?

### Further reading
- https://drewdevault.com/2022/02/07/Free-software-licenses-MIT.html
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tailwind CLI creates .css which violates MIT License" (#11536)

Issues.Title: Comment with url instruction seems to be interpreted by tailwindcss
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

For example: Next.js ^13.4.7

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v16.14.0

**What browser are you using?**

For example: Chrome, Arc

**What operating system are you using?**

For example: macOS

**Reproduction URL**

[You can test the issue here](https://github.com/Clement-Muth/tailwindcss-issue-comment-interpreted)

**Describe your issue**

This comment below seems to be interpreted in my Nextjs webapp

## Source of the issue : 

```jsx
// `before:bg-[url(${src})]`;
```

## Entire component :

```jsx
import Decoration from "~/views/Home/Hero/Decoration";
import Footer from "~/views/Home/Hero/Footer";
import Gallery from "~/views/Home/Hero/Gallery";
import Title from "~/views/Home/Hero/Title";

const Home = () => {
  // `before:bg-[url(${src})]`;
  return (
    <main className="py-7">
      <section className="flex flex-col h-[calc(100vh-25px-28px-57px)]">
        <Title />
        <Decoration />
        <Gallery />
        <Footer />
      </section>
    </main>
  );
};

export default Home;
```

## Screenshot of the error
||
|---|
| ![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/58605856/d50ba174-8019-4768-9ae7-39d56565d047) |
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Comment with url instruction seems to be interpreted by tailwindcss" (#11524)

Issues.Title: Unexpcted behavior of pseudo-selectors chain
Issues.Body:
Tailwind CSS 3.3.2
Node.js v18.15.0
Chrome
Windows 10

My relavant config:
addVariant('child-a', '& > a')

The code of pseudo-selectors chain:
`child:not(last):child:first:child-a:hover:`

Expected css generated:
`& > *:not(:last-child) > *:first-child > a:hover `

Actual css generated:
`&:hover > a:first-child > *:not(:last-child) > * `
This behavior is reversed and unintuitive.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unexpcted behavior of pseudo-selectors chain" (#11522)

Issues.Title: Unexpected scrolling behaviour when applying effects to an image
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

 NextJs: "13.4.7", postcss: "8.4.24"

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18.13.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome, Edge

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/test-nextjs-13-tailwind-forked-pf6mf2?file=%2Fstyles%2Fglobals.css%3A4%2C1

**Describe your issue**

When applying brightness or other image effects to an Image, it goes over any sticky or fixed element when scrolling, like the header in my example. 

The example is written using Image API from NextJs but it also happens with the classic image. 

`      <header className="sticky top-0 w-full p-6 bg-black text-white flex items-center">
            <Link href="/">Hola</Link>
      </header>
      <section className="my-8">
            <Image
              src={"/apparel.jpg"}
              alt={"Apparel"}
              width={300}
              height={350}
              className="brightness-50 hover:brightness-100"
            />
      </section>`

Is this the expected behaviour?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unexpected scrolling behaviour when applying effects to an image" (#11525)

Issues.Title: [Bug]: Example of Sticky Positioning Element Not Working in Tailwind Docs
Issues.Body:
## Description:
I noticed an issue with the example of the sticky positioning element in the Tailwind CSS documentation. The example provided is not functioning as expected. To demonstrate the problem, I have attached a video showcasing the issue.

## Environment:

Browser: Brave Browser (version: [Please specify version])
Tailwind CSS version: v3.3.2

## Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to the documentation page containing the example for sticky positioning.
2. Observe that the sticky positioning element does not behave correctly.

## Expected Behavior:

The sticky positioning element should stick to the specified position on the page as the user scrolls.

## Actual Behavior:
The sticky positioning element does not stick to the specified position and behaves incorrectly when scrolling.

## Attached Files:

https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/109217591/27b0b64f-2e2a-49ce-9da9-18902c0babe5
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: Example of Sticky Positioning Element Not Working in Tailwind Docs" (#11509)

Issues.Title: Sort classes using position of first matching rule
Issues.Body: Fixes https://github.com/tailwindlabs/prettier-plugin-tailwindcss/issues/174 Given a list of components like this: ```js addComponents({ '.foo': { display: 'block' }, '.foo-1': { display: 'block' }, '.bar': { display: 'block' }, // This rule matches both the utility `foo` and `bar` // But when sorting `foo` — we've already got a // position for `foo` so we should use it '.bar .foo': { display: 'block' }, }) ``` Note that the last rule matches both the utilities `foo` and `bar`. When sorting lists of classes we would iterate over all generated rules. Given that last rule matches both `foo` and `bar` it would win for any instance of `foo` used. This means that the utility `foo` would have a much "later" position than expected. For example, `foo-1 foo` would be sorted and stay as-is instead of becoming the expected `foo foo-1`. Now, given that we cache rules, the internal utility we used to match against them could be overwritten. As such, once you used `bar` the utility was permanently changed and no longer matched the utility `foo` causing the sort order to change for any list of classes _after_ the one that used the utility `bar`. All that to say, given this HTML: We would see the following HTML file as having sorted classes: ```html ``` When in reality it should be this: ```html ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Sort classes using position of first matching rule" (#11504)

Issues.Title: less don't support arbitrary value about shadow
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.2

**What happened**

I want to use shadow arbitrary values in less like this:
```css
/* ./tailwind-init.less */

@layer components {
  .theme-shadow {
    @apply shadow-[0_0_14px_rgba(200,200,0,1)];
  }
}
```
 but the less seems not support the syntax, is there some ways to fix it?

**Reproducation link**

- ✅ CSS: https://play.tailwindcss.com/hUUu0nhMx7?file=css
- ❌ Less: https://lesscss.org/less-preview/#eyJjb2RlIjoiXG5AbGF5ZXIgY29tcG9uZW50cyB7XG4gIC50aGVtZS1zaGFkb3cge1xuICAgIEBhcHBseSBzaGFkb3ctWzBfMF8xNHB4X3JnYmEoMjAwLDIwMCwwLDEpXTtcbiAgfVxufSIsImFjdGl2ZVZlcnNpb24iOiI0LjEuMyJ9

 Astro's Tailwind integration

macOS

https://github.com/zellwk/tailwind-preset-bug

Describe the problem you're seeing, any important steps to reproduce and what behavior you expect instead.

I included a preset according to Tailwind's documentation, but these presets do not get loaded into Tailwind's engine. Any values defined in the preset doesn't work. It's as if the preset wasn't loaded at all.

Issues.Title: Text with gradient does not work in all browsers or with text decoration
Issues.Body:
## Describe your issue
Using text with gradient (bg clip text, bg gradient and transparent text) does not work properly in: a) Bullet points are not displayed in Chromium (Chrome, Safari,...) based browsers. Firefox displays them without problems. b) Underline does not work with gradient text in any browser. 

(See image or demo link below)

## Reproduction URL

Demo: https://play.tailwindcss.com/joQJnTTxGx?layout=horizontal

Image:

Tailwind: 3.3.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Next.js 13.4.5, autoprefixer ^10.4.14, postcss 8.4.24

v20.2.0

Testing on Firefox, Chrome and Safari.

MacOS
